channel.title: 2 shop values!
channel.description:
I currently just created a credit store.
Now, this is mixing in with the [code=java]c.sendMessage(c.getItems().getItemName(removeId)+": currently costs " + getSpecialItemValue(removeId) + " points.");[/code]
How would i create a new shop cost for special items i declare in the "credit" shop?

item.title: 2 shop values!

item.description:

item.title: 2 shop values!
item.dc:creator: @cammyPVPftw cammyPVPftw
item.description:
@cammyPVPftw wrote:

[code=java]private int getCreditValue(int id) {
switch (id) {
case 4151:
return 50;
case 6585:
return 50;
case 1050:
return 500;
case 15001:
return 350;
case 15000:
return 350;

 		}
return 0;

}[/code]

Thanks for the starting code base sk8.
got everything working 100% properly!

Cheers mates.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 shop values!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“cammyPVPftw, post:4, topic:537019”]Think you can help with making that new method?
what files would be edited?[/quote]
It’d all be done in the same file as you’re editing. Find int getSpecialItemValue
Should look like:

public int getSpecialItemValue(int itemID){//It could be private, and the int name inside the parans. can differ.
     switch(itemID){//This name will be the same as above.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     case 1235://Item ID
          return 120;//How much it's worth.
     }
}

Now obviously it won’t be that ‘exactly’ but similar.

Above that one, or below it really doesn’t matter where this goes, as long as it isn’t in another method.

You make basically the same thing, but with a different name.

private int getCreditValue(int itemId){ switch(itemId){ case 1: return 200; } }
It’s not hard.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 shop values!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:2, topic:537019”]getSpecialItemValue(removeId)

put the values in that method[/quote]
Or similar, you can create a new method, like getCreditValue(int itemId)
and it’d be used in a similar fashion, but this way it doesn’t have a chance of using other values already set.
